intro: Glockeria blepharorhachis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm, with dark green, velvety leaves that are often marked with silver or white patterns. It produces clusters of violet or purple flowers that bloom throughout the year under proper care. This plant thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
